title: Possible human remains recovered from Titan wreckage, Coast Guard says
description: U.S. medical professionals will analyze the remains as the U.S. Coast Guard begins a high-level investigation into the cause of the Titan’s implosion.

title: After Wagner mutiny, Navalny asks why he, not Prigozhin, is jailed
description: When his lawyers told him about the crisis, the imprisoned Russian opposition leader wrote: “I thought it was some kind of new joke or internet meme that hadn’t reached me yet.”

title: At least 11 killed when missile strike hits popular restaurant in Kramatorsk
description: At least 11 were killed when a missile slammed into Ria, a restaurant and hookah bar where civilians, journalists, aid workers and soldiers could grab a bite, and stable WiFi.

title: Putin’s standing as global strongman in jeopardy after revolt
description: The Wagner Group mutiny has jeopardized Vladimir Putin's strongman image, jolting assumptions about his autocratic credentials and Russia’s stability.

title: A 15-year-old girl vanished at the Vatican. The case still haunts Italy.
description: Pope Francis on Sunday publicly referenced “Vatican girl” Emanuela Orlandi, who disappeared 40 years ago this month, fueling baseless claims and a Netflix documentary.

title: Food in France and Italy? ‘Not that great,’ Brazil’s president complains.
description: Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva's complaints about meals in the culinary hot spots of Italy and France echoed the old joke: The food was bad and the portions too small.

title: Protests erupt in Paris after police shoot, kill teen during traffic stop
description: An officer is in custody after police shot and killed a 17-year-old, named by lawyers as Naël M, in a traffic stop in the Parisian suburb of Nanterre.

title: Kevin Spacey trial opens in London court. Here’s what to know.
description: The American actor faces a dozen charges, including of sexual assault dating from between 2001 and 2013.

title: Canadian leader: Teachers can’t use student pronouns without parent okay
description: New Brunswick Premier Blaine Higgs says the change will safeguard parental rights. Opponents say it will put children from unsupportive families at risk.

title: Excavators find image of pizza’s possible precursor among Pompeii ruins
description: The food depicted in the roughly 2,000-year-old fresco did not include cheese and tomato but could be a “distant ancestor” of pizza, archaeologists said.

title: Ukraine live briefing: 8 dead in Kramatorsk strike; Putin dissuaded from killing Wagner boss, Lukashenko says
description: The bombing of a Kramatorsk pizza restaurant frequented by members of the military and foreign journalists also injured 56 people, including an 8-month-old.

title: In Afghan hospitals, feeling abandoned by the Taliban — and the world
description: The war's end has only worsened Afghanistan's health-care crisis.

title: Palestinians explore the pleasures, and perils, of hiking the West Bank
description: Hiking groups provide Palestinians with social connections and a new view of their ancestral land. As settler violence surges, though, the trails are more dangerous.

title: U.S. is far more globally popular under Biden than it was in Trump era
description: New polling from the Pew Research Center underscores a shift in international attitudes toward the United States.
